DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Domain Biospecimen Collection Timepoint Text Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A free-text description of a timepoint when a specimen/sample was taken that is different from the pre-specified values.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information.

Concepts.definition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
